page.title: 11Leaden Roding Fire Station 2
page.content: The fire engine currently being used at Leaden Roding is a 1972 Dennis Water Tender powered by a Jaguar 4.2 litre six cylinder petrol engine. Leaden Roding Fire Station is currently manned by 10 Retained Firemen,each having regular jobs and only attending the fire station for training,esential maintenance work and in response to fire calls. They are called out to fire calls by the Brigade Fire Control at Hutton,using a radio transmitter to set off pocket alerters carried by the firemen. The location of the fire is recorded on a tape machine at the station and is played back when the firemen arrive. The station at Leaden Roding attends approximately 50 calls a year,the majority of these calls being to give assistance to neighbouring stations.
